content: I received a 28% autograder score on pset 4, but it passed all of the test cases so I was wondering how to see where points were taken off or if it will be looked at again for a better score?
subject: how to see breakdown of autograder pset score?

content:
<md>Hi Katie,

You should be able to view the autograder breakdown by going to your scores page and clicking the "Autograder" link next to the percentage.

![autograder.png](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=paste%2Fj7ax2om9jjz55%2Ff44a829ec40a1490ad7293b22f4639608122c00874ae3fd669f5f50b0fb2b53f%2Fautograder.png)

Here's the link that the autograder should direct you to: https://sicp-s1.mit.edu/fall22/scores/autograder?ps=4&course=1.

I've attached the autograder results below if you're not able to access the above link for some reason.
[katiekat.pdf](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=paste%2Fj7ax2om9jjz55%2F3ad2017d17faef013693c78b4fcb14ff62a92d6290460c7487379ed48232ebce%2Fkatiekat.pdf)</md>

I passed all of the failed test cases when I ran them on my own laptop, is there a way to ask for a manual grade? I don't know what could've gone wrong between me submitting it and it getting tested, as I re-started the console and re-ran the tests immediately before submitting to confirm everything was correct.

<md>The test cases on the server differ from the ones given in the student handout – for example, we test that your code is able to extract columns from the dataset other than "Close". However, your code has the column index hard-coded, which is why you lost points in those test cases.

We can give you a manual grade but your score may not change.</md>
